DC2013 Chap08

Multiple Choice
Identify the choice that best completes the statement or answers the question.
 

 1. 
Which of the following kinds of software, such as operating systems and utility programs, consist of the programs that control or maintain the operations of a computer and its devices?
a.
System
b.
Application
c.
Management
d.
Program
 

 2. 
A cross-platform program is one that runs in what way?
a.
only on one operating system
b.
differently on every operating system
c.
the same on multiple operating systems
d.
differently on one operating system
 

 3. 
During a cold boot on a personal computer, the POST (power-on self test) results are compared with data in which of the following chips?
a.
CMOS
b.
UNIX
c.
BIOS
d.
SCSI
 

 4. 
Which of the following is firmware that contains a computer’s startup instructions?
a.
POST
b.
BIOS
c.
CMOS
d.
DIOS
 

 5. 
With which of the following do users interact with menus and visual images such as icons, buttons, and other objects to issue commands?
a.
command-line interface
b.
menu-driven interface
c.
performance-monitor interface
d.
graphical user interface (GUI)
 
 
 

 6. 
In an interface like the one shown in the accompanying figure, a user types commands or presses special keys on the keyboard (such as function keys or key combinations) to enter data and instructions. What is the term for this kind of interface?
a.
command-line interface
b.
menu-driven interface
c.
performance-monitor interface
d.
graphical user interface (GUI)
 

 7. 
Networks, servers, mainframes, and supercomputers allow hundreds to thousands of users to connect at the same time, and thus their operating systems are referred to as which the following?
a.
single user
b.
single processing
c.
multiuser
d.
multiprocessing
 

 8. 
Which of the following means the operating system automatically configures new devices as users install them?
a.
Virtual memory
b.
Operational buffering
c.
Page logging
d.
Plug and Play
 

 9. 
Which of the following is Microsoft’s fastest, most efficient operating system to date, offering quicker application start up, built-in diagnostics, automatic recovery, improved security, and enhanced searching and organizing capabilities?
a.
Windows Vista
b.
Windows XP
c.
Windows 2010
d.
Windows 7
 

 10. 
Which of the following is a multitasking operating system developed in the early 1970s by scientists at Bell Laboratories?
a.
Linux
b.
Perl
c.
NetWare
d.
UNIX
 
 
COGNITIVE ASSESSMENT
 

 11. 
What is another term for the operating system a computer uses?
a.
system utility
b.
file manager
c.
platform
d.
application
 

 12. 
What is the core of an operating system that manages memory and devices, maintains the computer’s clock, starts programs, and assigns the computer’s resources?
a.
the kernel
b.
the cylinder
c.
the core
d.
the BIOS
 

 13. 
The POST checks the various system components during the startup process. What does POST stand for?
a.
primary operating system trial
b.
primary onset series trial
c.
power operating system test
d.
power-on self test
 

 14. 
What is the definition of a fault-tolerant computer?
a.
a computer that runs a spell checker program automatically
b.
a computer with a firewall and other antivirus and security systems
c.
a computer that backs up its system automatically to ensure if it fails the data and programs are intact
d.
a computer that continues to operate when one of its components fails
 

 15. 
What happens when the computer is thrashing?
a.
A hacker is attempting to circumvent antivirus software and firewalls.
b.
Items are being released from being stored in memory because the processor no longer requires them.
c.
The computer is exchanging data between memory and storage.
d.
The operating system spends too much of its time paging, instead of executing application software.
 

 16. 
While waiting for devices to become idle so that they can receive additional instructions, where does the operating system place items?
a.
a spool
b.
a buffer
c.
virtual memory
d.
a queue
 

 17. 
What is an error in a program called?
a.
a germ
b.
a bug
c.
an error
d.
a virus
 

 18. 
Which of the following statements is not true about server operating systems?
a.
A server operating system organizes and coordinates how multiple users access and share resources on a network.
b.
Some operating systems have network features built into them.
c.
Shared resources include hardware, software, data, and information.
d.
Client computers cannot function unless they are connected to the network because they cannot access an operating system.
 

 19. 
To prevent unauthorized users from reading data as it travels over a network, what process should the administrator specify?
a.
encryption
b.
decoding
c.
scrambling
d.
authorization
 

 20. 
What is the definition of open source software?
a.
a multitasking operating system
b.
proprietary software that is licensed for free
c.
its code is provided for use, modification, and redistribution
d.
software that resides on a network server
 

True/False
Indicate whether the statement is true or false.
 

 1. 
Regardless of the size of the computer, most operating systems provide similar functions.
 

 2. 
When a computer is turned on, the charge of electricity causes the processor chip to reset itself and find the ROM chip(s) that contains the BIOS.
 
 
 

 3. 
A disadvantage of Linux is that it is available only in a command-line version like the one in the accompanying figure.
 

 4. 
Users today typically run multiple programs concurrently.
 

 5. 
If a new device, such as a printer or scanner, is attached to a computer, its driver must be installed before the device can be used.
 

 6. 
If the user name and password entered match the user name and password kept on file, an operating system grants access to the user.
 

 7. 
Client operating systems can operate with or without a network.
 

 8. 
The difference between stand-alone operating systems that include networking capabilities and server operating systems is that server operating systems are designed specifically to support all sizes of networks, including medium- to large-sized businesses and Web servers.
 

 9. 
Instead of backing up to a local disk storage device, some users opt to back up their files using online storage.
 

 10. 
Some personal computer maintenance utilities continuously monitor a computer while it is used and repair problems before they occur.
